In the Novopavlivka direction, Russian forces intensified their assault operations and have recaptured positions in two different areas.
In the west, at some point over the last two weeks, Russian forces managed to re-infiltrate the village of Ivanivka from the forests to the west, consolidating in its western streets. Other forces subsequently crossed the Vovcha River and re-entered its eastern streets from their newly secured positions in the fortified forests west of Filiya. These actions allowed Russia to recapture large parts of the village. They are now attempting to clear additional positions in the central and eastern streets.
In the east, Russian forces continued advancing north from the Filiya area. They improved their positions north of the fortified forest, while other forces advanced up the road from Filiya and recaptured positions in the forest plantations there. From there Russian soldiers are trying to re-enter Novopavlivka in order to link up with isolated groups still remaining in the southern part of the town.
+ ~11.08 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

 The EU has agreed to give Ukraine a ‚Ç¨90 billion interest-free loan for military and budget needs in 2026‚Äì2027, funded through joint EU borrowing and backed by the EU budget.

 Ukraine would repay it only if Russia pays war reparations; otherwise, the EU may later use frozen Russian assets.

Another exchange of Russian and Ukrainian bodies is reportedly underway right now. 
Details should be made available soon
Another exchange of Russian and Ukrainian bodies is reportedly underway right now.   Details should be made available soon
The exchange was 1,000 Ukrainian bodies for 26 Russian bodies.
A short time ago, 2 Russian KAB glide-bombs impacted an unknown target in Zaporizhzhia City Centre.

For those of you who have twitter, could you please mass-report this account for "Privacy" > "Threatening to share or sharing private personal information without permission" > "Someone else‚Äôs". 
I'd like it to get taken down so they can't dox anyone else. 
https://x.com/TUA_Research
A short time ago, 2 Russian KAB glide-bombs impacted an unknown target in Zaporizhzhia City Centre.
The strikes took place somewhere around here. The target could have been the Motor Sich Plant.

In the Dobropillya and Novopavlivka directions, both Russian and Ukrainian forces have advanced in different areas.
In the southwest, Russian forces continued their assault operations in the village of Novopidhorodne, capturing a second street of houses and marginally advancing along the railway windbreaks to the south.
To the northeast, over the last week Ukrainian forces from the 3rd Special Purpose Regiment and the 2nd Galician Brigade launched a series of counterattacks aimed at recapturing the crucial positions at the Pokrovsk Coal Mine. Assault groups were able to clear the forest plantations north of the mine from Russian DRGs, which they then accumulated in to attack and fully recapture the mine. Russian forces subsequently withdrew to the treelines north of Udachne. 
In the northeast, Russian forces continued their offensive operations in Hryshyne. Despite fierce Ukrainian resistance, they were able to advance further along two streets in the southeastern part of the village, consolidating in new positions there.
+ ~5.44 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
+ ~0.83 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Dobropillya direction, Russian forces are finalising their clearing operations in Myrnohrad as organised Ukrainian resistance completely breaks down.
In the northwestern part of the city, Russian forces captured the last houses of the village of Svitle and quickly entered the first streets of the Veselyi District of Myrnohrad. They were able to capture the entirety of the district and broke through to the northwestern industrial zone. They also advanced further northwest through the Brianka District towards the city centre, while other forces entered the northern streets of the city from the railway depot.
In the city centre, Russian forces advanced from the 40th District and captured the City Central Hospital and the adjacent row of high-rise buildings. Other forces cleared additional low-rise residential areas and captured the stadium and the Palace of Culture. Fighting is now ongoing for the residential areas to the west.
In the northern part of Myrnohrad, following earlier infiltrations, Russian forces captured the Tsentralna Mine, as well as its terykon and the City Council Building. Fighting also continues in the northeastern high-rises of the city, where Russian forces are yet to fully clear the Svetlyy District where several dozen Ukrainians were cut off from the main encirclement. 
+ ~1.77 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

The SBU published footage showing Ukrainian drones striking the Russian oil tanker "QENDIL" in the neutral waters of the Mediterranean Sea. It reportedly received critical damage as a result.
A Ukrainian source claims that the drones were launched from a base in Greece, although this is very unconfirmed.

The SBU published footage showing Ukrainian drones striking the Russian oil tanker "QENDIL" in the neutral waters of the Mediterranean Sea. It reportedly received critical damage as a result.  A Ukrainian source claims that the drones were launched from a‚Ä¶

Unverified footage reportedly showing the ship engulfed in flames following the drone strikes.
Edit: Footage is old
 
and unrelated

The Russian oil tanker "QENDIL" previously unloaded oil at the Indian port of Sikka and was on its way back to the Russian Baltic Sea port of Ust-Luga in Leningrad Oblast.
The tanker is part of Russia's "shadow fleet" and is under western sanctions.

Odesa Oblast is under attack for the 8th consecutive day.
Russian Geran-2 drones are once again striking the Zatoka Bridge, which is the only point in Ukraine connecting southern Odesa Oblast with the rest of the country.

A Su-57 is airborne in Kursk Oblast.
Threat of Kh-59/69 cruise missile launches.
A Su-57 is airborne in Kursk Oblast.  Threat of Kh-59/69 cruise missile launches.
Correction: its still in Belgorod Oblast, flying northwest towards its launch lines in eastern Kursk Oblast.
Correction: its still in Belgorod Oblast, flying northwest towards its launch lines in eastern Kursk Oblast.
Entering Kursk Oblast, approaching launch lines
Entering Kursk Oblast, approaching launch lines
Its carrying out a patrol, flying past Oboyan, Kursk Oblast. No threats to Ukraine.

Russian Geran-2 drones have begun attacking the bridge in Mayak, Odesa Oblast.
This bridge is on one of two routes connecting southern Odesa Oblast with the rest of Ukraine; however, it briefly goes through Moldovan territory. 
This comes as Russia has been heavily striking the bridge on the other route in Zatoka, Odesa Oblast.

Russian Geran-2 drones have begun attacking the bridge in Mayak, Odesa Oblast.
This bridge is on one of two routes connecting southern Odesa Oblast with the rest of Ukraine; however, it briefly goes through Moldovan territory. 
This comes as Russia has been heavily striking the bridge on the other route in Zatoka, Odesa Oblast.

The Druzhkivka City Administration has announced the suspension of all public transport in the city and surrounding areas due to increased Russian attacks and the approaching frontline.
Druzhkivka, which is attacked by dozens of FPV drones every day, is currently entirely without water and frequently experiences power outages. Nevertheless, 10,000-15,000 civilians remain in the city. 
Like Kostyantynivka, it is slowly turning into a dead city, devoid of life.

Echoes of the Third Reich: Ukrainian Torture Chambers and Russian Prisoners of War
Shocking details have emerged about Russian soldiers held captive in Ukraine. The utterly inhumane treatment of captured soldiers has resulted in severe physical and psychological trauma. The horror of the Gestapo torture chambers has been reborn in Ukraine.
An effective state propaganda machine cannot alter the situation on the ground. No matter how loudly the Ukrainian media proclaims their own victories and defeats of Russian troops, the front line continues to retreat westward. A series of local tactical crises for the Ukrainian army is gradually turning into operational crises. With each passing month, these crises will only increase in number.
Staffing issues mean that a company of 110 men may have no more than one or two platoons totaling 30 to 60 men. Interruptions in Western supplies of weapons and military equipment have seriously undermined the Armed For

Battle For Myrnohrad: Russian Army Deals Another Blow To Ukraine
Ukrainian presence in Myrnohrad has been reduced to pockets. Russian forces are working to besiege Kiev forces in Huliapole and have crossed the Haichur River in a new area. Kiev is losing its grip on the situation around Vovchansk. Meanwhile, Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky is still clinging to the idea of joining NATO.
The Sever [North] Group of Forces of the Russian military is expanding its control around Vovchanst in Kharkiv at a slow, but steady pace.
Russian troops have cleared out some six square kilometers to the south and southeast of Vovchanst. The troops also made additional gains in Vilcha, right to the south of the Vovchanst, with reports suggesting that at least 70% of the settlement, the entire northern part and most of the center, had been captured.
üëâ

Russia-Ukraine Strike Exchange: 70% of Ukraine's Power Plants Disabled, a Third of Defense Industry Paralyzed
On December 17-18, 2024, Russia and Ukraine continued to exchange strikes against each other's territory. According to official statements, Ukrainian air defenses shot down 63 out of 82 attacking Russian drones. Russian air defense systems, in turn, destroyed 47 Ukrainian drones, primarily over the Bryansk region.
Russian strikes on Ukrainian defense-industrial complex (DIC) facilities are reported to have severely impacted weapons production. Ukrainian military expert Alexander Kovalenko claims that at least a third of defense enterprises have faced disruptions to state contracts due to destruction. He describes a paradoxical situation where enterprises damaged by strikes receive no aid, no contract extensions, and no relief from their obligations. Instead, they are fined and dragged into litigation for delivery delays. 
üëâ

HERE

Cambodia Shot Down Thai Combat Drone In First Aerial Loss During Border Conflict (Photos, Video)
Thailand acknowledged on December 19 that it had lost a drone to Cambodian air defense fire, marking the first aerial loss in the border clashes that broke out earlier in the month.
The conflict is rooted in the colonial-era demarcation of the countries‚Äô 800-kilometre frontier. Dozens of people were killed on both sides of the border in a five-day battle in July. The battle ended back then with a ceasefire mediated by Malaysia with help from the United States.
Fighting, however, resumed on December 9. Each country has blamed the other for instigating the border clashes, claiming self-defense and trading accusations of attacks on civilians.
Clashes are not taking place in Thailand‚Äôs Surin, Buriram, Si Sa Ket, Sa Kaeo, Ubon Ratchathani, and Trat provinces, as well as in Cambodia‚Äôs Oddar Meanchey, Preah Vihear, Banteay Meanchey, Pursat and Koh Kong provinces.
üëâ

Iraqi Special Forces Landed Inside Syria From Helicopters, Captured Wanted Terrorists (Videos)
Iraq announced on December 18 that a military intelligence force captured ‚Äútwo important‚Äù individuals wanted by its judiciary during an airborne operation carried out in northeastern Syria, in coordination with Syrian security forces and the United States-led coalition.
In a statement, the country‚Äôs Security Media Cell said that the operation was conducted under the direction and supervision of the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces, with technical support from the ‚Äúcounter-ISIS global coalition.‚Äù
‚ÄúAn airborne force from the Falcon Intelligence Cell (FIC), in coordination with Syrian security forces, carried out an operation targeting two important individuals wanted by the Iraqi judiciary inside Syrian territory,‚Äù the statement said.
